description: Cashew curry (Kaju Maluwa) is a celebration of Sri Lankan taste and texture – a vegan delight from Sri Lanka and the South of India, this creamy curry surprises on every level.
ingredient: [{"name": "cashew nuts", "units": "cups", "amount": 2}, {"name": "turmeric powder", "units": "tsp", "amount": 0.5}, {"name": "cumin powder", "units": "tsp", "amount": 1}, {"name": "clove powder", "units": "tsp", "amount": 0.25}, {"name": "cinnamon powder", "units": "tsp", "amount": 0.5}, {"name": "cardamom powder", "units": "tsp", "amount": 0.25}, {"name": "coriander powder", "units": "tsp", "amount": 2}, {"name": "chilli powder", "units": "tsp", "amount": 0.25}, {"name": "paprika", "units": "tsp", "amount": 0.25}, {"name": "salt", "units": "tsp", "amount": 1}, {"name": "coconut oil", "units": "tbsp", "amount": 2}, {"name": "curry leaves", "units": "pieces", "amount": 10}, {"name": "star anise", "units": "pieces", "amount": 2}, {"name": "fennel seeds", "units": "tsp", "amount": 0.5}, {"name": "onions", "units": "pieces", "amount": 2}, {"name": "coconut milk", "units": "cups", "amount": 1.5}, {"name": "cilantro", "units": "for garnish", "amount": null}]
step_by_step: 1. Add the cashew nuts to a bowl, cover with cold water and soak for 1 hour. 2. In a bowl, add all the curry paste ingredients. Add ¼ cup water and whisk to combine. Set aside. 3. Once soaked, drain the nuts and place into a saucepan. Pour over 3 cups fresh water and add the turmeric. Bring to a boil and reduce the heat to simmer gently for 30 minutes. 4. Once cooked, remove from the heat, drain and retain the cooking liquid. Set both aside. 5. Heat the coconut oil in a saucepan over a moderate heat until hot. 6. Add the curry leaves, star anise and fennel seeds and let them sizzle for 30 seconds before adding the diced onion. Stir well to combine, then stir fry for 5-7 minutes until they are soft and golden brown. 7. Add the curry paste and stir for 1-2 minutes being careful not to burn the spice. Add a little of the cashew nut cooking liquid if things get too hot. 8. Tip in the cashew nuts and stir well before pouring in the coconut milk and about 1/2 cup of the cashew cooking liquid to thin out the sauce a little. 9. Stir well, then pop on a lid and cook over a low temperature - a light simmer for 10 minutes. 10. Remove from the heat and check for seasoning, adding a little salt if needed. 11. Sprinkle with fresh cilantro and serve.

notes: Add some heat to your curry by incorporating a spicier chili powder into the sauce or throwing in some fresh green chilies with the cashews. For an authentic touch, consider adding green peas, spinach, fresh or frozen fenugreek leaves, potatoes, chickpeas, or other vegetables and pulses to your Kaju Maluwa.
